meanings.definition: A line connecting points of equal magnetic intensity.
meanings.sent1: The isogones on the map show where the magnetic intensity is the same.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use isogones to study the magnetic field of the Earth.
meanings.sent3: The isogones on the map decided to have a party at the same intensity level.
meanings.sent4: The isogones acted like a magnetic highway guiding the compasses.
meanings.sent5: The isogones glowed on the map, marking their equal magnetic strength.

meanings.definition: A line connecting points of equal slope on a topographic map.
meanings.sent1: Hikers follow isogones to navigate areas with the same slope.
meanings.sent2: The isogones on the map help in planning hiking trails.
meanings.sent3: The isogones on the map decided to race each other uphill.
meanings.sent4: The isogones resembled contour lines, guiding the path for climbers.
meanings.sent5: The isogones painted a clear picture of the terrain's uniformity.
